message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I really like the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. That's the most I'm willing to pay.
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway. How about we compromise at $87? It's a great price for a fantastic product like this.
I appreciate the effort to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about $85? That's the lowest I'm willing to go.
I'm getting close to your target, Bob! I'm willing to make one more concession. How about we meet at $86? It's a great deal for both of us.
I'm getting close to my target, but I think we can do even better. How about $84? That's the absolute most I'm willing to pay.
I'm not willing to go any lower, Bob. I think we're close to a deal, but I need to make sure I get a fair price. How about we meet at $85? It's the best I can do.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still a bit higher than $85. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $84 and $85, so how about $84.50? That's the lowest I'm willing to go.
I'm not willing to budge from $85, Bob. I think we're very close to a deal, and I'm willing to make a small concession. How about we meet at $84.75? It's the best I can do.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not willing to go above $84. I think we've been negotiating for a while, and I'm starting to think it's time to walk away. I'll make one last offer: $84, and that's my final offer. If you can't meet me there, I'll have to consider buying from John for $100.
